problem.p: Now that you have an idea of what algorithms are, let's do some brainstorming. Which of the following could be important when choosing the best algorithm to solve a problem? Check all that apply.

div.p: The following will be based on the example of choosing a cooking recipe.
Length/Time: Assume you are tyring to boil an egg. This should be a simple fast task. So you wouldn't want an algorithm/recipe that would take 24hours to boil an egg.
Efficiency: Assume you are trying to bake a cake. A recipe tha gives you tips on how to make the cake more moist or nice smelling is preferred to one than just names the products to combine.
Side Effects: Assume you are trying to bake potatoes. You want to make sure that the recipe you follow does not involve a risk of lighting the kitchen on fire for example.
